metadata.title: CVE-2022-34472 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If there was a PAC URL set and the server that hosts the PAC was notreachable, OCSP requests would have been blocked, resulting in incorrecterror pages being shown. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102, FirefoxESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
